full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: That's correct , 1,000 RIB . I'll need your personal code to deposit this . Could you enter it on this key pad , please ? Turn 2 Speaker_2: <|MASK|>  Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: It will show in your account straight away . Here's your card back and could you please sign the slip here ?
response_1: OK , done . When will it show in my account ? Not for withdrawal , I mean just registered .
response_2: *enters personal code on keypad* There you go.

full_dialogue: Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: I'm sorry, he is not here at the moment. He has gone to the International Business Center. Turn 4 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 5 [Speaker_1]: I'm not sure, he didn't say when he wound return. If you'd like.you can leave him a message until he is back to you until the moment it's free.
response_1: Do you know when he will be back?
response_2: When do you expect him back?

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Hi, could you help me with my plans? I am looking for a train. Turn 2 Speaker_2: <|MASK|>  Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: I will be departing from Cambridge and going into Ely on Saturday.
response_1: I can help you with that. Where will be departing and where do you want to go?
response_2: I'd be happy to help you find a train. Where will you be departing from and what's your destination?

full_dialogue: Turn 15 [Speaker_1]: Is that a hotel or a guesthouse? Turn 16 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 17 [Speaker_1]: Okay, thanks! Can you please book a room for 2 people, for 3 nights, starting Wednesday?
response_1: It is a guesthouse.
response_2: It is a guesthouse.

full_dialogue: Turn 7 [Speaker_1]: And when do you need to fill the vacancy, Mr. Parsons? Turn 8 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 9 [Speaker_1]: That sounds ideal.
response_1: I usually fill it with allowance. I don't want to draw any fumes in the room.
response_2: Yesterday! But no, we are hoping to start from the beginning of next month.

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Thank you. I also need a train from Cambridge on Thursday. Turn 2 Speaker_2: <|MASK|>  Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: I must arrive by 12:45.
response_1: Sure. Where are you headed to and what time would you like to leave Cambridge?
response_2: I'd be happy to help you find a train from Cambridge on Thursday. What is your destination and what time would you like to travel?

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: I do need 4 star hotel as well. Turn 2 Speaker_2: <|MASK|>  Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: I would like it to be in the expensive range too.
response_1: I can help you find a 4 star hotel. What area of the city would you prefer, and do you have a price range in mind?
response_2: great, i have 21 options for you!

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: I would also like to see somewhere fun to go in the centre of town. Turn 2 Speaker_2: <|MASK|>  Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: I would like to visit an entertainment attraction
response_1: I can help you find fun places to visit in the centre of town. There are several attractions available including museums, theatres, and entertainment venues. What type of attraction are you most interested in?
response_2: There are many fun things to do in the centre. Do you know what type of attraction you would like?

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Sure, give me their phone number. I'd also like to find an expensive restaurant in West Cambridge. Turn 2 Speaker_2: <|MASK|>  Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: That sounds good. Could you reserve a table for 3 on Friday at 19:00? Can I get a reference number? Thank you!
response_1: Here's the number for the Museum of Classical Archaeology, 01223335153. How does the Cambridge Lodge Restaurant sound for you?
response_2: The phone number for XXXXXXX is XXXXXXX. For expensive restaurants in West Cambridge, I recommend XXXXXXX, which serves XXXXXXX cuisine. They're located at XXXXXXX and are highly rated.

full_dialogue: Turn 5 [Speaker_1]: I'm looking for a italian place in the moderate price range. Can you suggest one and make reservations please? Turn 6 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 7 [Speaker_1]: Yes, that sounds great, thank you. I want to book a table for 4 people at 15:15 on Wednesday. I'll also need a reference number.
response_1: Ok, there is pizza hut fen ditton in the centre, shall I book that for you?
response_2: May I recommend Prezzo, it is located in the west and has a moderate price range. Is there a specific date, time and number of people?

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Oh great! This stupid computer froze again! That's the third time today! Hey Samuel, can you come take a look at my PC? It's acting again. It must have a virus or something. Turn 2 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: But I'm quite careful when I'm browsing theinternet, I have no idea how I could have picked up a virus.
response_1: Just give me a second. I'll be right up. I ran a virus scan on your computer, and it turns out that you have a lot of infected files!
response_2: They wouldn't find anything. You could keep it paid, because you're very careful about these things.

full_dialogue: Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: Sunday, sometime after 12:00 Turn 4 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 5 [Speaker_1]: Yes, I want to book for 7 people.
response_1: The first train after 12:00 is the TRisers3 which leaves from Norwich to Cambridge. Would you like me to book that one for you?
response_2: The TR5225 leaves at 12:16. Would you like to book it?

full_dialogue: Turn 13 [Speaker_1]: do you like working in teams with people from different departments? Turn 14 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 15 [Speaker_1]: do you like working in teams?
response_1: I like working with the people I work with and getting to know them and they get to know me.
response_2: yes, it helps everyone to understand what we're doing from different perspectives.

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Hello , ABC company . Turn 2 Speaker_2: <|MASK|>  Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: Just a moment . I am sorry . At the moment , he is out of the office . Would you like to leave your number ? When he comes back , I will tell him to call you back .
response_1: Hello, I'd like to speak with XXXXXXX, please.
response_2: Hello , this is Mr . Morris Pitt . I'd like to speak to Mr . Bell , please .

full_dialogue: Turn 15 [Speaker_1]: Great, thank you! Also, can you please book me a taxi between the restaurant and Funky Fun House? I want to leave the restaurant by 01:30. Turn 16 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 17 [Speaker_1]: Thank you for your help.
response_1: Your car is booked. You should be expecting a black Lexus. If you need to contact the driver, please call 07955921789.
response_2: Sure. I booked a red Toyota for you from the Cherry Hinton Hall and Grounds, contact number 072094 varying06.

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Have you anything to ask about the job ? Turn 2 Speaker_2: <|MASK|>  Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: Yes . If you undertake additional courses , provided these are approved , and you complete them successfully , you can claim back part , quite a large part , 75 % of the costs you incurred . Not just the fees , - traveling and other expenses too .
response_1: Is there any support for professional development or training courses?
response_2: Yes . Do you offer any opportunities for further study ?

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: Could you please tell me your phone number , so we'll give you a ring as soon as the remittance has arrived ? Turn 2 Speaker_2: <|MASK|>  Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: Thank you . We'll inform you in time . Goodbye .
response_1: My phone number is XXXXXXX.
response_2: The phone number is 328 6765 extension 105 .

full_dialogue: Turn 9 [Speaker_1]: Yes, that could do. I need the trainID and ticket price, please. Turn 10 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 11 [Speaker_1]: Ok great, that is everything I needed to know. Thank you for your help!
response_1: The travel time for TR3006 is 60 minutes. The price is 17.90 GBP per ticket.
response_2: The trainID is TRПр3 and the price is 16.60 pounds.

full_dialogue: Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: Thank you for your interest. The position is still available. Have you already sent your CV to us? Turn 4 [Speaker_2]: <|MASK|> Turn 5 [Speaker_1]: It is urgent for us to fill this position now and I would like to stress that English is a must because of the international contacts and most likely traveling abroad very soon. If all these is not problem for you, I recommend you to mention these in your cover letter and send it to me directly.
response_1: No, not yet. First, I want to check about the availability and see if you could give more information.
response_2: No, I haven't.

full_dialogue: Turn 1 [Speaker_1]: What repayment period were you thinking of ? Turn 2 Speaker_2: <|MASK|>  Turn 3 [Speaker_1]: A wise decision . If you decide to take out a short-term loan with us , say for 6 months or less , the interest rate shall be for that of a 6 - month loan .
response_1: Say , 6 months ? Or less in fact . I want to repay the loan ASAP ; I don't like debt hanging over my head .
response_2: I'm considering a shorter term, maybe around 6 months.
